name: 莊惠鈞
objective:
本課程幫助學生習得敘述、描寫、推論、議論、省思、說明等文體方面的寫作技巧，並指導學生從閱讀、圖片、日常生活事件，及課堂討論內容中取材，以加強邏輯思考和流暢寫作能力。
This course aims to develop and reinforce students' strengths to create unified and coherent pieces of composition in a variety of styles--narrative, descriptive,  argumentative, reflective, and expository.  Students will be guided to write in response to readings, pictures, events in their daily lives, and discussions from the class.  Thought-provoking topics dealing with current issues are used to stimulate and foster critical writing strategies. This course enables students to write and discuss logically and clearly; they also need to incorporate grammatically newly-built vocabulary into their writing.
schedule:
Tentative Schedule (Details will be provided in the first week of the semester.)

W1-3: Introduction to CMT and the basics of academic writing. Topics include thesis development, coherence, and argumentation.

W4-6: Teaching core CMs, their cultural implications, and their role in English 
academic writing.

W7-9: Practical application of CMs in expository and analytical writing tasks. Students practice organizing their ideas around metaphorical frameworks.

W10-12: Integration of AI tools for writing. Workshops include prompt engineering 
and iterative refinement of drafts using AI feedback.

W12-15: Advanced writing strategies, including argumentative writing and peer 
reviews. Students analyze rhetorical strategies and refine their work based on CMs and AI feedback.

W16-18: Final projects and presentations. Students present CM-based writing 
samples, demonstrating their understanding of the cognitive framework and its application.
scorePolicy:

2. Assignments (as needed): 30% 
3. Midterm Exam: 15%
4. Final Exam: 25%
